There's a short cut that takes you over to Fleming/Harding golf course if you don't want to run the entire length.  As you near the road to Harding near the site of the old "Boathouse" restaurant, you can enter the area where all the BBQ kings convene for their picnics and watch the dragon boaters practice at various times in the AMs.  Not uncommon to see signs up during the year indicating a race or marathon of some sort along the path.
author: Ry T.

description: I really wanted to love my run around Lake Merced today.  Unfortunately I didn't start until 5:30pm and it was pretty dark.  I figured that the street lights would light up the sidewalk enough, but they didn't cut it.  Once I got to John Muir Dr. there were no lights.  It was kinda scary too and I was afraid someone was going to jump out of the bushes at me and drown me in the lake.  Okay, that's a little extreme but it could happen.  I am currently training for the Kaiser 1/2 marathon and I am a new runner.  I've never really run before at all.  It was a good beginner course and I look forward to running there during the day.  It's not a good idea to go at night cause you might twist an ankle.  Also, there are two trails side by side.  The pavement is on the outside and there is dirt  is on the inside.  Once I'm in better shape I plan to utilize the circuit training equipment that's located along the trail.  If you see me running here, don't laugh...I'm still learning!
author: Jennifer B.

description: used to jog the lake merced loop after work at least 2 or 3 times a week, back when i actually left work before the sun went down.  really enjoyed the views of the lake.  didn't like the south end of the lake very much though, where it's a bit more sketchy and urban.
author: spiff e.

description: I absolutely hate running on the treadmill. I can barely make it through a mile on the treadmill, but run the 5 mile lap at Lake Merced with ease. I love this trail because of the dirt path which makes it easier on my joints. I also enjoy the breeze and smell of nature during my runs. They completed the area that was under construction... looks good. -.5 for those who WALK on the dirt, thus having me pass by on the concrete. No biggy though..as I don't own the trail. Plenty of parking in different sections of the Lake.
author: Simon S.

description: i've came here many times. the first time was dragon boat practice. i was so excited, but the water is so dirty! i smelled like crap after practice! ew. this place is big and theres a lot of bbq grill and tables too. i'd also came here for bbq with a bunch of my friends and the place is good to run around! this place is good except for their smelly lake. don't touch the lake or you're smell like smelly bear!
author: Valerie N.

description: Its just good for jogging/walking or some kinda activities like that. When i went there some people were fishing. But its not kinda place were you can sit and enjoy the beauty of the beach. As others said, the parking lot is kinda small. You can use the bridge, if you are looking for small circle to go around.
author: HD S.

description: For beginners daring to get into active running, this is the best spot for you. It's convenient. There is parking. It's a complete loop. Even though I'm one of the few black folks who run around this lake, I can tell you that it's better to run when it's crowded. Why? If you're running when there aren't a lot of people, you will feel isolated and out of place with all the cars passing by. Moreover, it is not recommended to run at night since it can get really dark along the path.
author: Akinyemi O.

description: Lake Merced is loaded with good memories for me. I used to row here with Pacific Rowing Club, it was my first outdoor workout area before that and it was where I discovered just how much I hate golf; or it hates me. In any case Lake Merced is a good runner's area for so many reasons. It can be neatly divided up based on landmarks. There is the dam run where you run south out of the parking lot to the dam and back. Then there's the long dam run where you just cut out that small snippet at the end and just continue around the lake. There's the small lake run where you run north out of the parking lot and cut through the golf course on the way back (mind you, you might get yelled at, oh well). Every now and again you can hear the echo's of gunshots from the Pacific Range and SFPD. Let me tell ya, I didn't know about the gun range when I first started rowing and it is pretty scary being in the water thinking someone is trying to pick you off like a metal duck at a fair booth.
author: Alia D.

description: Ahhh Lake Merced...I ran there quite a few times... and I have always just had an okay run....I know that alot of people love it, its a 4 1/2 loop around for a good jog distance. I think I like to have more things to look at than a lake and greenery,I dont like the stretch that is near an apartment complex and a shooting range,especially alone or on a foggy day  or at night...I never enjoyed training there for the Nike Women's Marathon with Team in Training...its was always a drag. I would rather run on Ocean Beach and have the ocean view and the breeze as I run with my nikeplus ipod...To me its just a depressing run at the lake.......When I ran the Nike Marathon,Lake Merced was part of the run and it was also the most grueling part of the race as we reached the last leg of the marathon which hit miles 20-23...I hit my wall at the lake with lalaine.....which means we hit our wall of complete exhaustion and pain in our legs that it was unbearable......I remember about to cry running  around that lake and the ghiradelli chocolate mile at around mile 23 still didnt make me a happy camper , I took some and ate it while running umm maybe in tears........so maybe that has alot to do with how I feel about Lake Merced today........I ran it today after the storm broke....and again I hated it....I ran over fallen trees and a poor golden colored fish that apparently got flown out from the lake :( that was sad and on christmas day!! Im sorry Lake lovers......I rather not run LakeMerced...theres other places in SF that are more uplifting for a nice run.......
author: Apple S.
